answers.answer: Hi, there are many causes of numbness such as local compression over nerves esp. during abnormal sleep postures, diabetes, electrolyte abnormalities, deficiency of vitamin B1, B6, B12 esp secondary to chronic alcohol intake, hypocalcaemia etc. Even hypothyroidism too can present with numbness of extremities. As Strokes are concerned the symptoms depends upon the type of stroke and size of the embolus or thrombosis. It usually start with headache associated with vomiting and then person is known to sustain neurological deficits like loss of vision, numbness in extremities, paralysis etc. Some of the symptoms may reverse too. I would suggest him to undergo routine investigations like blood sugar, thyroid status, complete blood count etc. He needs to take vitamin B-complex supplements which will help. Treatment of the route cause remains as mainstay of treatment. I still suggest him to consult physician. Take care and regards.

If he will not go to the Doctor, who would give him medication anyway, try a chiropractor. I have had problems like that with a pinched nerve. They are an alternative to medication which most people do not want.
